Definition: This profile sets minimum expectations for the CarePlan resource to record, search, and fetch assessment and plan of treatment data associated with a patient to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation

This profile sets minimum expectations for the CareTeam resource for identifying the Care Team members associated with a patient to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.

The US Core Condition Problems and Health Concerns Profile is based upon the core FHIR Condition Resource and meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 ‘Problems’ and ‘Health Concerns’ requirements and SDOH ‘Problems/Health Concerns’ requirements.

This profile sets minimum expectations for the Goal resource to record, search, and fetch Goal information associated with a patient to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.
When referencing a medication, the MedicationRequest resource can either use a code or refer to a Medication resource
The US Core Medication Request Profile is based upon the core FHIR MedicationRequest Resource and meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 ‘Medications’ requirements.

To promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation, this profile is based on the base FHIR Vital Signs Profile and defines additional constraints on the Observation resource to represent vital signs observations

To promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation, this profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch Body Mass Index (BMI) observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure

To promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation, this profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch diastolic and systolic blood pressure observations with standard LOINC codes and UCUM units of measure.

To promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation, this profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch body weight observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure.

To promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation, this profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch body height observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure.

To promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation, this profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch heart rate observations with a standard LOINC code and UCUM units of measure.

Profile: US Core Laboratory Result Observation Profile
Definition: The US Core Laboratory Result Observation Profile is based upon the core FHIR Observation Resource, and, along with the US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Laboratory Results Reporting, meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 ‘Laboratory’ requirements.

Profile: US Core Observation Social History Profile
Definition: The US Core Observation Social History Profile meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 ‘SDOH Assessments’ requirements.

Profile: US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile
Definition: The US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile is based upon the core FHIR Observation Resource and implementers the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 Smoking status’ requirements.

Profile: US Core Observation Clinical Test Result Profile
Definition: The US Core Observation Clinical Test Result Profile is based upon the core FHIR Observation Resource, and, along with the US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Report and Note exchange, meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 ‘Clinical Tests’ requirements.

This profile sets minimum expectations for the Practitioner resource to record, search, and fetch basic demographics and other administrative information about an individual practitioner to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.
The US Core Procedure Profile is based upon the core FHIR Procedure Resource and meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 ‘Procedures’ requirements

The US Core Implantable Device Profile is based upon the core FHIR Device Resource and meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 ‘Unique Device Identifier(s) for a Patient’s Implantable Device(s)’ requirements.

This profile sets minimum expectations for the Encounter resource to record, search, and fetch basic encounter information for an individual patient to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.
Concepts classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.
